remarks: Lemma for ~ dia2dim .  The sum of vectors ` G ` and ` D ` belongs to the sum of the subspaces generated by them.  Thus, ` F = ( G o. D ) ` belongs to the subspace sum.  Part of proof of Lemma M in [Crawley] p. 121 line 5.  (Contributed by NM, 8-Sep-2014.)
statement:
dia2dimlem5.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem5.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.

dia2dimlem5.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem5.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dia2dimlem5.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
dia2dimlem5.r $e |- R = ( ( trL ` K ) ` W ) $.

dia2dimlem5.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` Y ) $.
dia2dimlem5.pl $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` Y ) $.
dia2dimlem5.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` Y ) $.
dia2dimlem5.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoA ` K ) ` W ) $.
dia2dimlem5.q $e |- Q = ( ( P .\/ U ) ./\ ( ( F ` P ) .\/ V ) ) $.
dia2dimlem5.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dia2dimlem5.u $e |- ( ph -> ( U e. A /\ U .<_ W ) ) $.

dia2dimlem5.f $e |- ( ph -> ( F e. T /\ ( F ` P ) =/= P ) ) $.
dia2dimlem5.rf $e |- ( ph -> ( R ` F ) .<_ ( U .\/ V ) ) $.

dia2dimlem5.ru $e |- ( ph -> ( R ` F ) =/= U ) $.
dia2dimlem5.rv $e |- ( ph -> ( R ` F ) =/= V ) $.
dia2dimlem5.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. T ) $.
dia2dimlem5.gv $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` P ) = Q ) $.
dia2dimlem5.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. T ) $.
dia2dimlem5.dv $e |- ( ph -> ( D ` Q ) = ( F ` P ) ) $.
dia2dimlem5 $p |- ( ph -> F e. ( ( I ` U ) .(+) ( I ` V ) ) ) $.
